description: Data Loading — Load the dataset from 'http://127.0.0.1:5000/dataset/rotor.vti' using vtkXMLImageDataReader.
Data Processing — Set the active scalar array to 'Pressure' and compute the slice index at 95% depth along the Y-axis using the dataset's dimensions, then apply vtkImageSlice to extract the slice.
Visualization Setup — Configure a color transfer function with a blue-to-white-to-red gradient spanning the full range of 'Pressure' scalar values and assign it to the vtkImageMapper for rendering.
Opacity Configuration — Set the opacity to fully opaque (value 1.0) across all pressure values with no transparency variation.
UI Components — Add an orientation marker with XYZ axes in the bottom-right corner of the render window using vtkOrientationMarkerWidget.
Rendering — Initialize the render window, renderer, and interactor to display the sliced volume with the configured color map and orientation marker.
Data Loading — Load the Deepwater dataset from 'http://127.0.0.1:5000/dataset/deepwater.vti' using vtkXMLImageDataReader.
Data Processing — Compute the velocity magnitude from arrays 'v02' and 'v03' using vtkCalculator; if either array is unavailable, use 'prs' as the scalar field.
Isosurface Generation — Generate an isosurface at the mid-value of the computed scalar range using vtkContourTriangulator or vtkImageMarchingCubes.
Color Mapping — Apply a blue → white → red color map spanning the full scalar range (min to max) using vtkColorTransferFunction for the isosurface.
Surface Rendering — Configure the isosurface to be fully opaque with smooth shading using vtkMapper and appropriate property settings.
Orientation Marker — Add an XYZ orientation marker in the bottom-right corner of the render window using vtkOrientationMarkerWidget.
Rendering — Initialize the render window, renderer, and interactor to display the isosurface with the orientation marker.
Data Loading — Load the Isabel dataset from 'http://127.0.0.1:5000/dataset/isabel.vti' using vtkXMLImageDataReader.
Data Processing — Extract the 'Velocity' vector array as the flow field for streamline computation.
Seed Generation — Generate a dense grid of seed points at the center of the dataset to ensure full domain coverage for streamline integration.
Streamline Computation — Compute streamlines using the velocity field and seed points via vtkImageStreamline.
Streamline Rendering — Render streamlines with cyan color ([0, 1, 1]) and a specified line width using vtkMapper and vtkGlyph3DMapper.
Outline Generation — Generate a bounding box outline of the dataset using vtkOutlineFilter.
Outline Rendering — Render the dataset outline in red ([1, 0, 0]) with a specified line width using vtkMapper.
Rendering Setup — Configure the render window, renderer, and interactor to display both streamlines and outline simultaneously.
Data Loading — Load the dataset from 'http://127.0.0.1:5000/dataset/redsea.vti' using vtkXMLImageDataReader.
Data Processing — Compute the velocity magnitude from the 'velocity' array using vtkCalculator and set it as the active scalar.
Volume Rendering Setup — Configure volume rendering using vtkVolumeMapper with a piecewise opacity function that maps scalar values to transparency.
Color Mapping — Apply a blue → white → red color transfer function to the volume mapper, spanning the full scalar range from minimum to maximum velocity magnitude.
Volume Appearance — Set shading, ambient, diffuse, and specular properties for realistic volume rendering using vtkVolumeProperty.
Camera Configuration — Adjust the camera to look along the +Z axis and center on the dataset bounds.
Rendering — Initialize the render window, renderer, and interactor to display the volume-rendered dataset.
